content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice for clash of code
Specify the inherent order of the characters in the grid. Give a maximum limit for N.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Yes it is good for a CoC but it is only a frequncy vector(array) i'll upvote it :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems like it would work well in all game modes, and can be compressed into a very neat bit of code if you're clever enough. I like it

I find it interesting, but the game would be pretty much the same if the input was a string instead of a grid.
It might be more interesting to play the game upside down : the input could be the run-length encoding, and the output the grid. This would allow to discover the pretty drawing by decoding the input !
Anyway I enjoyed solving this puzzle.

I simplified the text by removing references to grid cells and clarified where strings are used.

I also think there's no reason this couldn't be a game of reverse, so I enabled that too.
